metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36694 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in netfilter in the Linux kernel before 5.10. There can be a use-after-free in the packet processing context, because the per-CPU sequence count is mishandled during concurrent iptables rules replacement. This could be exploited with the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability in an unprivileged namespace. NOTE: cc00bca was reverted in 5.12.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-aws - 4.4.0-1102.107
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1114.127~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1114.127~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.107').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1114.127~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1114.127~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255~14.04.1').
